intro: Caladenia brachyscapa, commonly known as the narrow-scape spider orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-brown flowers that resemble spiders, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. Its flowering period occurs during the cooler months, usually from late autumn to early spring. Caladenia brachyscapa is a member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is known for its unique floral morphology and ecological significance in its native environment.
